definition: good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Public opinion is volatile and prone to large swings.
sentences.chinese: 公众意见是善变的，易受大风波的影响。

sentences.english: Boh Runga: Fashion is fickle and faddy.
Never ask me whether the changeable world will still be what it is tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 永远不要问，善变的世界明天是否依然如故。

sentences.english: I'm afraid your fickle dissolute mood is not stable.
sentences.chinese: 我怕自己善变放荡的情绪不太安定。

sentences.english: If you lose the flip, an opponent gains control of Fickle Efreet. Flame chooses its own course.
sentences.chinese: 若你输掉此掷，则由一位对手获得善变魔神的操控权。

sentences.english: A woman in addition to the fickle, also like duplicity.
sentences.chinese: 女人除了善变，还喜欢口是心非。

sentences.english: Quick as quicksilver to change, he was mercurial in nature and therefore unreliable.
sentences.chinese: 变得像水银那样快，他天性善变，因此不可靠。

sentences.english: Beating remorseful and loud the mutable sands of the sea-shore.
sentences.chinese: 似懊悔着大声拍打海岸上善变的白沙。

definition: to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
lit. to like the new, and hate the old (idiom); fig. enamored with new people (e.g. new girlfriend), bored with the old
fickle (in love affairs)/dissipated/unfaithful/heart of a flower (pistil and stamen)
